thread.title: Nishikori holds off Kyrgios to advance in Shanghai
thread.title_full: Nishikori holds off Kyrgios to advance in Shanghai

title: Nishikori holds off Kyrgios to advance in Shanghai
text:
Nishikori overcomes challenge from emotional Kyrgios to advance to 3rd round in Shanghai By JUSTIN BERGMAN Associated Press   4:29   4:29   
East Asia (691) 

SHANGHAI â€” Kei Nishikori overcame a stiff challenge from an emotional Nick Kyrgios to advance to the third round of the Shanghai Masters with a 1-6, 6-4, 6-4 win on Wednesday. 
After winning the first set in 30 minutes, Kyrgios began to unravel at the end of the second set when he smacked a ball in frustration toward the baseline, causing a line judge to bend to avoid being hit. 
The Australian was assessed a code violation and dropped his serve at love, losing the set. Kyrgios then saved three match points in the third set before Nishikori finally closed it out. 
Kyrgios was fined $1,500 for an "audible obscenity" in his first-round match in Shanghai. He faces suspension from the ATP tour if he reaches $5,000 in fines before February.
